speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Good morning, thank you for calling ISS Insurance Ltd. My name is Priya, how may I help you today?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Morning Priya! Oh, finally got through, the line was a bit busy just now, must be popular ah! Yes, I'm calling about travel insurance. My husband and I are planning a trip soon, very exciting!

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: That sounds wonderful! I can certainly help you with information about travel insurance. To start, could you let me know where you'll be travelling to?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, we're planning a trip to Thailand! Phuket, specifically. It's our anniversary trip, celebrating 20 years, can you believe it? Time flies lah! We haven't been back since before the kids were born, feels like a lifetime ago.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Congratulations on your anniversary! Thailand is a great choice. And how long will you be away for?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: We'll be away for 2 weeks. Leaving from Singapore, of course. Just nice, enough time to relax but not too long away from home.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, 2 weeks in Thailand, departing from Singapore. And how many people will be travelling?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Just the two of us this time! The kids are old enough to look after themselves... mostly! Ha! So, it's a trip for 2. We're mostly around 41-55 years old, still young at heart though!

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Noted, 2 travellers in the 41-55 age group. During your 2 weeks in Thailand, are you planning any specific activities? Sometimes people like to do water sports or hiking.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Oh yes! Definitely! That's actually one of the main things! We want to try Scuba Diving. My friend went last year and her photos were incredible, under the sea with all the fish! I've always wanted to try it. So we need coverage for Scuba Diving, just in case, you know? Better safe than sorry when trying new things.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Right, planning for scuba diving. That’s good to know. Are there any specific medical considerations for either traveller? For example, any pre-existing conditions or special equipment you need to bring?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: No special medical equipment needed, thankfully. But my husband, David, has high blood pressure. It's well-controlled with medication he takes daily, but do we need to declare high blood pressure? We want to make sure that if, God forbid, something happens related to that, or anything else really, we have proper medical coverage. Getting sick overseas is my biggest worry – finding a doctor, hospital stays, you know.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, I've noted the query about declaring high blood pressure and the need for comprehensive medical coverage during the trip. Besides medical concerns, are there any other aspects of the travel you're thinking about?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Well, you know how flights are these days! Always seem to be delays. We were stuck in Hong Kong airport for nearly 9 hours once, horrible experience! It cost a fortune just eating at the airport cafe. So, yes, what happens if our flight gets delayed significantly? Need to know we're covered for extra hotel nights or meals if we get stuck.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, so cover for significant travel delays causing additional expenses like accommodation and meals.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Exactly! And speaking of delays... this is maybe a bit unusual, but we have a cat, Snowy. She's like our third child, really. She'll be staying at a pet hotel while we're away. If our flight back to Singapore gets cancelled or super delayed, we'd need her to stay there longer. That costs extra, you know! So, I was wondering, is there *any* possibility of getting cover for those extra pet hotel fees if we are delayed getting back?

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood, you're specifically asking about coverage for additional pet accommodation costs incurred if your return to Singapore is unexpectedly delayed. I've made a note of that requirement. Thinking about the journey itself, what about your belongings?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Oh goodness, yes, luggage! My sister-in-law, her suitcase got completely mangled on a trip to Australia last year. Wheels broken, handle snapped off! speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Makes sense, coverage for lost, damaged, or delayed baggage. What about unforeseen circumstances *before* you travel? Things that might force you to cancel the trip altogether?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Ah, cancellation, yes. Touch wood, hopefully not! But you never know, right? Like if one of us gets seriously ill just before we're supposed to leave, or there's a bad family emergency back home. We've already paid for flights and the hotel booking is non-refundable after a certain date. So, yes, cover for trip cancellation due to major reasons like illness or emergencies is important.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Right, noted: trip cancellation coverage. And finally, do you have a particular budget in mind for the travel insurance policy for the two of you?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Budget... hmm. We were thinking something around $400 for the insurance for both of us for the two weeks? Is that realistic for the kind of things we need? We're flexible, but yeah, around $400 would be ideal.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, noted a budget of around $400. Thank you, Mrs. Lim, that gives me a clear picture of your needs. The budget is around $400. Have I captured everything correctly?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, Priya, that sounds exactly right! You've got it all down. It feels good to list it all out, makes me feel more organised, haha! Thanks for being so patient, I know I can chat a bit!

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Not at all, Mrs. Lim, it's important we understand exactly what you need. Thank you for providing all the details. I have recorded these requirements. Have a great day and enjoy planning the rest of your anniversary trip!

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Thank you so much, Priya! You've been very helpful. Have a lovely day too! Bye bye.
